content.full_text:
Abraham Lincoln to Henry E. Dummer, 2 January 18441 In reply to yours of the 14thult.2I say that if you can get a clear title to the 40 acres of land, together with costs,

and a reasonable fee to yourself, I reckon you had better do it– Have the deed made

to me–
paragraphs: Abraham Lincoln to Henry E. Dummer, 2 January 18441 In reply to yours of the 14thult.2I say that if you can get a clear title to the 40 acres of land, together with costs,
and a reasonable fee to yourself, I reckon you had better do it– Have the deed made

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincoln wrote and signed the letter. He also authored the address on the back
                  page, which was folded to create an envelope for mailing.
2Henry E. Dummer’s December 14, 1843 letter to Lincoln has not been located.

In reply to yours of the 14thult.2I say that if you can get a clear title to the 40 acres of land, together with costs,
               and a reasonable fee to yourself, I reckon you had better do it– Have the deed made
               to me–
